alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 28 at 6:06PM PST until March 01 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves are expected due to elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet. Surf will be highest on west facing beaches. * WHERE...Ventura County Coast. * WHEN...Through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning due to the hazardous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
